titleStmt.title: The Muses dirge consecrated to the remembrance of the high and mightie monarch, Iames, by the grace of God, late king of Great Brittaine, France, and Ireland; who deceased at Theobalds, vpon Sunday, being the seuen and twentieth of March, 1625. / VVritten by Richard Iames, Master of Arts, and preacher of Gods Word at Stoke-Newington, in the countie of Middlesex, neere London.
titleStmt.author: James, Richard, 1592-1638.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by A[ugustine] M[athewes] and I[ohn] N[orton] for Iohn Browne, and are to bee sold at his shop in Pauls Church-yard, at the Signe of the Crane,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in Pauls Church-yard, at the Signe of the Crane
